The master shall come and answer this once and for all (ok kidding but I work in the DVD industry for a major release 
company). The reason there are no danish subs (or danish audio, or norwegian subs or audio for that matter) is because some   
movie/DVD distributors sometimes split the DVD release for Scandinavian countries into seperate releases and (not doing a 
"one-for-all-Scandinavia").

THIS IS TO ACOMMODATE BITRATE. That's the only reason. You see, with extras, too many audio tracks
for every Scandinavian country will eat up the whole DVD and not allow for much extras.

So why not do a retail 2-disc release?
Well dont ask me. 2-disc costs somewhat more to manufacture, and on a popular title that has aspects of selling in the 100 of
thousands, it adds up.

Bottom line, on multi-audio releases you will sometimes see seperate NO/DK and SE/FI or NO/SE or SE/DK
or whatever various retail DVD releases. And those are the sources of the pirate copies like this one, so the only one to 
blame is... well, the movie distributor. All understood? Fine. ;)

Hi, I hope that somone can help me.

I've DL the file, seemed to be no problems.
I've then tried to extract the img with winrar, but it won't, it claims 1) Theres not enough disc space (got about 20 GB free on the drive I'm trying to extract to) and 2) Only NTFS based file systems can handle files above 4 GB - and I'm running winXP pro, which as far as I can tell is NTFS based....

Can anyone help? Please?

beer4ever, you probably have disc FAT32 formatted, which can't handle such big files. However you can easliy convert your disc to NTFS. I did it on one of my XP computers.

You can find information on how to convert here: http://aumha.org/win5/a/ntfscvt.htm
